demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.i, count(*) FROM photoobj   GROUP BY photoobj.i ;

demonstrations.input: Find the magnitude and number of photometric objects grouped by their magnitudes.
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.r, count(*) FROM photoobj   GROUP BY photoobj.r ;

demonstrations.input: Find the declination and number of photometric objects grouped by their declination.
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.dec, count(*) FROM photoobj   GROUP BY photoobj.dec ;

question: How many photometric objects for each photometrically observation type are there?

demonstrations.input: How many photometric objects have mode of photometric observation = 1 and field number is 712
demonstrations.query: SELECT count(*) FROM photoobj  WHERE photoobj.mode = 1 AND photoobj.field = 712 ;

demonstrations.input: How many photometric objects have field number equal to 731
demonstrations.query: SELECT count(*) FROM photoobj  WHERE photoobj.field = 731 ;

demonstrations.input: How many photometric objects have what extinction values?
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.extinction_r, count(*) FROM photoobj   GROUP BY photoobj.extinction_r ;

question: Find right ascension, declination and photometric type class of equivalent width estimates of galactic-stars from these spectroscopic objects.

demonstrations.input: Find the right ascension and magnitude of the photometric objects that have spectroscopic objects with type of 1
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.ra, photoobj.r FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2primary = 1 ;

demonstrations.input: Find the right ascension and velocity dispersion error of spectroscopic objects whose segue2_primary_objects is -2147483391 and with photometric objects whose magnitude_g - magnitude_i < 0.82525 and magnitude_g - magnitude_i > -0.38665
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.ra, specobj.veldisperr FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2_target1 = -2147483391 AND photoobj.g - photoobj.i < 0.82525 AND photoobj.g - photoobj.i > -0.38665 ;

demonstrations.input: Find spectroscopic objects whose photometric object has mode of photo observation other than 1
demonstrations.query: SELECT specobj.class FROM specobj  JOIN photoobj  ON specobj.bestobjid = photoobj.objid WHERE photoobj.mode != 1 ;

question: Fetch the right ascension and declination of spectroscopic objects those have equivalent width estimates of galactic-stars

demonstrations.input: Fetch the count and modified julien date of spectroscopic objects that have a value of 54857
demonstrations.query: SELECT count(*), photoobj.mjd FROM specobj  JOIN photoobj  ON specobj.bestobjid = photoobj.objid WHERE photoobj.mjd = 54857 GROUP BY photoobj.mjd ;

demonstrations.input: Find the galactic latitude and magnitude of the photometrically observed objects that have spectroscopic objects with segue2_primary_objects = -2147483391
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.b, photoobj.r FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2_target1 = -2147483391 ;

demonstrations.input: Find the right ascension and magnitude of the photometric objects that have spectroscopic objects with type of 1
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.ra, photoobj.r FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2primary = 1 ;

question: Find the object id and photometric observation type of photometric objects whose right ascension is greater than 100 and declination is less than 100.

demonstrations.input: Find the position of the center and the neighbor mode of the photometric objects with object id, whose composite modelmagnitude g - composite modelmagnitude r is less than 0.38262, and the difference of the two is greater than 0.224941.
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.colc, neighbors.neighbormode FROM photoobj  JOIN neighbors  ON photoobj.objid = neighbors.objid WHERE neighbors.neighbortype = 6 AND photoobj.cmodelmag_g - photoobj.cmodelmag_r < 0.38262 AND photoobj.cmodelmag_g - photoobj.cmodelmag_r > 0.224941 ;

demonstrations.input: Find the right ascension and magnitude of the photometric objects that have spectroscopic objects with type of 1
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.ra, photoobj.r FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2primary = 1 ;

demonstrations.input: Find the photometric object attributes flags, run number, composite modelmagnitude u, right ascension of objects with clean photometry flag = 1, with right ascension greater than 0.0296928124967337 and with field number = 818
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.flags, photoobj.run, photoobj.cmodelmag_u, photoobj.ra FROM photoobj  WHERE photoobj.clean = 1 AND photoobj.ra > 0.0296928124967337 AND photoobj.field = 818 ;

question: Retrieve the photometric object id and type name of corresponding photometric observation from the objects with the right ascension over 100 and declination below 100.

demonstrations.input: Retrieve the right ascension, mode of photo observation, declination and magnitude u of photometric objects whose modified julien date is 52681 and whose magnitude u greater than 14.4698 and run number is 5640
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.ra, photoobj.mode, photoobj.dec, photoobj.u FROM photoobj  WHERE photoobj.mjd = 52681 AND photoobj.u > 14.4698 AND photoobj.run = 5640 ;

demonstrations.input: Find right ascension, object type classification, mode of photometric observation and magnitude z of photometric objects with run number 259 and rerun number 301
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.ra, photoobj.type, photoobj.mode, photoobj.z FROM photoobj  WHERE photoobj.run = 259 AND photoobj.z > 12.1028 AND photoobj.rerun = 301 ;

demonstrations.input: Find the right ascension and velocity dispersion error of spectroscopic objects whose segue2_primary_objects is -2147483391 and with photometric objects whose magnitude_g - magnitude_i < 0.82525 and magnitude_g - magnitude_i > -0.38665
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.ra, specobj.veldisperr FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2_target1 = -2147483391 AND photoobj.g - photoobj.i < 0.82525 AND photoobj.g - photoobj.i > -0.38665 ;

demonstrations.input: Find the right ascension and velocity dispersion error of spectroscopic objects whose segue2_primary_objects is -2147483391 and with photometric objects whose magnitude_g - magnitude_i < 0.82525 and magnitude_g - magnitude_i > -0.38665
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.ra, specobj.veldisperr FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2_target1 = -2147483391 AND photoobj.g - photoobj.i < 0.82525 AND photoobj.g - photoobj.i > -0.38665 ;

demonstrations.input: Find the galactic latitude and magnitude of the photometrically observed objects that have spectroscopic objects with segue2_primary_objects = -2147483391
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.b, photoobj.r FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2_target1 = -2147483391 ;

question: What is the best photometric object to the corresponding spectroscopic object that has emission line estimates of galaxies? Return me the object id, right ascension and declination of the best object.

demonstrations.input: What is the magnitude of the photometric object with object id, best object id and modified julien date equal to 53678
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.g FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.mjd = 53678 ;

demonstrations.input: What is the right ascension and best object id of photometric object with a spectroscopic object with segue2_secondary_objects in a value of -2147481600
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.ra, specobj.bestobjid FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2_target2 = -2147481600 ;

demonstrations.input: What is the photometric magnitude of the object with best object id, whose segue2_secondary_objects is -2147483648
demonstrations.query: SELECT photoobj.g FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.segue2_target2 = -2147483648 ;

question: Find spectroscopic objects of equivalent width estimates of galactic-stars from these spectroscopic objects.

demonstrations.input: Find the number of spectroscopic objects with type 0 segue.
demonstrations.query: SELECT count(*) FROM specobj  WHERE specobj.segue2primary = 0 ;

demonstrations.input: Find the velocity dispersion of spectroscopic objects with segue2_secondary_objects = -2147481600 and declination = -18.964064 or declination = -17.031691
demonstrations.query: SELECT specobj.veldisp FROM specobj  WHERE specobj.segue2_target2 = -2147481600 AND specobj.dec = -18.964064 OR specobj.dec = -17.031691 ;

demonstrations.input: Find the count and spectroscopic subclass of objects with K5Ve (118100)
demonstrations.query: SELECT count(*), specobj.subclass FROM galspecline  JOIN specobj  ON galspecline.specobjid = specobj.specobjid WHERE specobj.subclass = "K5Ve (118100)" GROUP BY specobj.subclass ;

question: What is the equivalent width estimates of galactic-stars of spectroscopic objects

demonstrations.input: What is spectroscopically observed galaxy with velocity dispersion?
demonstrations.query: SELECT galspecline.specobjid, specobj.veldisp FROM galspecline  JOIN specobj  ON galspecline.specobjid = specobj.specobjid WHERE specobj.segue2primary = 0 ;

demonstrations.input: What is the distance center - neighbor of nearest neighbor objects with center type equal to 6, 0, 6, 3 and 1
demonstrations.query: SELECT neighbors.distance FROM neighbors  WHERE neighbors.type = 6 OR neighbors.type = 0 OR neighbors.type = 6 OR neighbors.type = 3 AND neighbors.mode = 1 ;

demonstrations.input: What is the program name of spectroscopic K0IIIa (57669) star with either a value of -2147481600 or -2147483616 in segue2_secondary_objects
demonstrations.query: SELECT specobj.programname FROM specobj  WHERE specobj.subclass = "K0IIIa (57669)" AND specobj.class = "STAR" AND specobj.segue2_target2 = -2147481600 OR specobj.segue2_target2 = -2147483616 ;

question: How many spectroscopic objects of equivalent width estimates of galactic-stars from these spectroscopic objects are there?

demonstrations.input: How many spectroscopic objects for each spectroscopic class are there?
demonstrations.query: SELECT specobj.class, count(*) FROM specobj  GROUP BY specobj.class ;

demonstrations.input: How many spectroscopic objects of subclass 'F2III (89254)' are there?
demonstrations.query: SELECT count(*), specobj.subclass FROM photoobj  JOIN specobj  ON photoobj.objid = specobj.bestobjid WHERE specobj.subclass = "F2III (89254)" GROUP BY specobj.subclass ;

demonstrations.input: How many spectroscopic Galaxy does exist?
demonstrations.query: SELECT count(*) FROM specobj  WHERE specobj.class = "GALAXY" ;

question: Find everything about spectroscopic objects and everything about emission line estimates of galaxies from these spectroscopic objects.

demonstrations.input: Find the count and spectroscopic subclass of objects with K5Ve (118100)
demonstrations.query: SELECT count(*), specobj.subclass FROM galspecline  JOIN specobj  ON galspecline.specobjid = specobj.specobjid WHERE specobj.subclass = "K5Ve (118100)" GROUP BY specobj.subclass ;

demonstrations.input: Find the velocity dispersion error of spectroscopic objects with 0 warning and subclass of 'CV'
demonstrations.query: SELECT specobj.veldisperr FROM specobj  WHERE specobj.zwarning = 0 AND specobj.subclass = "CV" ;

demonstrations.input: Find the velocity dispersion of spectroscopic objects with segue2_secondary_objects = -2147481600 and declination = -18.964064 or declination = -17.031691

question: Show me everything about emission line estimates of galaxies of corresponding spectroscopic objects

demonstrations.input: Show me the redshift of spectroscopic object with subclass of STARFORMING
demonstrations.query: SELECT specobj.z FROM specobj  WHERE specobj.subclass = 'STARFORMING' ;

demonstrations.input: Show me the spectroscopic object id of Galaxy
demonstrations.query: SELECT galspecline.specobjid FROM galspecline  JOIN specobj  ON galspecline.specobjid = specobj.specobjid WHERE specobj.class = "GALAXY" ;

demonstrations.input: Show me the spectroscopic object id of the spectroscopic object with subclass 'K5Ve (118100)'
demonstrations.query: SELECT spplines.specobjid FROM spplines  JOIN specobj  ON spplines.specobjid = specobj.specobjid WHERE specobj.subclass = "K5Ve (118100)" ;
